Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Programme Committee member of the CIBB2016, international Conference on Computational Intelligence Methods for Bioinformatics and Biostatistics

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: invited speaker “CLADAG & GfKl 2010” meeting Firenze (8-10 September)
invited speaker “Dyses 2010”, V meeting on dynamics of social and economic system, (20-25 September), Sannio University, Italy
September 2011: invited speaker “CLADAG 2011” - (7-9 September), Pavia, University of Pavia, Italy;
invited speaker at the XXXVI AMASES annual meeting, Vieste, Italy;

Session organiser, chair and speaker in Computational and Financial Econometrics - European Research Consortium for Informatics and Mathematics(CFE-ERCIM) Session CS88-Statistical methods and applications in health and finance 2013 meeting, University of London, UK

Session organiser, chair and speaker in Computational and Financial Econometrics -European Research Consortium for Informatics and Mathematics(CFE-ERCIM) 2014 meeting, University of Pisa, Italy Session ES129: Statistical methods and applications
Speaker at the Neuroscience Research Day, SITraN, University of Sheffield on “Count data analysis and biological networks”
Organizer and speaker of the Event “BAD DAY 1- Bioinformatics Awareness Day“, at the Sheffield Institute of Translational Neuroscience.
Invited speaker on “Comparative modelling of cell cycle dynamics across conditions using scRNA-Seq data” at Single Cell Omics Facility Launch Event, University of Sheffield, Uk (11th April)
Invited Speaker at the Researchers Away Day on “My experience with a Marie Sklodowska Curie Fellowship”, University of Sheffield, Uk (21th April)
Organizer of a research meeting day on single cells data analysis, SITraN, University of Sheffield, UK. Guests: Prof. Magnus Rattray and Professor Neil Lawrence.

Invited Speaker on “Unsupervised clustering of cells and genes across conditions using scRNA-seq“ at the Seminar “From Single Cell Analysis to Precision Medicine”, (16-18 June), at the Centro Congressi Federico II, Naples, Italy.
Organizer and speaker of the Event “BAD DAY 2- Bioinformatics Awareness Day“, at the Sheffield Institute of Translational Neuroscience.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Two months graduate visitor at the Georgia Institute of Technology (GATECH), Atlanta, U.S.A. under the supervision of Professor Brani Vidakovic; This short fellowship was financed under the University of Naples Federico II PhD Award Scheme. The aim of the visit was to develop a Wavelet based data filter.

European Molecular Biology Organization-EMBO Short Term Fellowship at the Computer Laboratory of the University of Cambridge, Uk. "Developing MCMC and variational Bayesian methods for multiple experiments identification of regulatory motifs". Supervisor Professor Pietro Lio'.

MARIE SKŁODOWSKA-CURIE post doctoral fellow (Fellowships (IF) Call:H2020-MSCA-IF-2014) at the Departments of Computer Science and SITraN of the University of Sheffield, Uk, under the supervision of Professor Neil Lawrence.
October-November 2016: Demonstrator at the BMS353 Bioinformatics for Biomedical Science, Department of biomedical science, University of Sheffield.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Active collaboration within the Computational and Synthetic Biology group led by Professor Diego di Bernardo at the Telethon Institute of Genetics and Medicine (Pozzuoli, Italy), directed by Professor Andrea Ballabio.
Active collaboration within the machine learning and computational biology group of Professor Magnus Rattray at the University of Manchester, where I hold a Visiting Position.
Host of a COST ACTION Short Term Scientific Mission "A similarity measure for the comparison of complex biological networks", CA15109 Collaborazione con Mirko Signorelli, University of Groningen

Responsabilita' scientifica per progetti.content: MARIE SKŁODOWSKA-CURIE Individual Fellowships (IF) Call:H2020-MSCA-IF-2014 “CONTESSA” “COuNt data TimESerieS Analysis: significance tests and sequencing data application”. This project is currently developed at the Departments of Computer Science and SITraN of the University of Sheffield, Uk, under the supervision of Professor Neil Lawrence. I am the PI of the project.
